snippet: Checkbooks are opening as Democrats try to keep control of the Senate and Republicans try to wrest it away, or at least gain ground.
abstract: Republicans are pouring money into crucial Senate races throughout the country in last-ditch effort before election to wrest control of Senate away from Democrats or at least gain ground.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and DEREK WILLIS
byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman reported from Painesville, Ohio, and Derek Willis from Washington. John Eligon contributed reporting from St. Louis, Jack Healy from Denver and Steven Yaccino from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: Checkbooks are opening as Democrats try to keep control of the Senate and Republicans try to wrest it away, or at least gain ground.

headline.seo: Last-Minute Money Pours Into Senate Races
headline.main: With Control of Senate at Stake, Last-Minute Money Pours Into Races
headline.print_headline: With Control of Senate at Stake, Last-Minute Money Pours Into Races
